definition: to amuse/to cause to smile/amusing
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
erhua variant of 逗笑[dou4 xiao4]

sentences.english: His jokes amused the whole table .
sentences.chinese: 他讲的笑话把满桌人都逗笑了。

sentences.english: Today, nobody, least of all Murdoch, is laughing.
sentences.chinese: 但是今天，没有任何人会被他的言论逗笑。

sentences.english: She tried to be funny- but the punch line didn't make anybody laugh.
sentences.chinese: 但是她那句逗笑的话却一点没引人发笑。

sentences.english: He was really funny, and I had fun being funny back.
sentences.chinese: 他真的非常有趣，我总是被他的幽默逗笑。

sentences.english: We were all amused by the story-teller's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们都被那个故事员的笑话逗笑了。

sentences.english: "The pests're at the bastard's, " she said, laughing sourly at her own joke.
sentences.chinese: “害虫在混蛋家里，”她被自己的笑话逗笑了。

sentences.english: Happinesss is making a baby laugh.
sentences.chinese: 幸福就是，把小北鼻逗笑。

sentences.english: It amused him to see people make fools of themselves.
sentences.chinese: 看到人们出洋相把他逗笑了。

sentences.english: The actress forgot her lines but ad-libbed very amusingly.
sentences.chinese: 这位女演员忘了台词，但她那即兴演出非常逗笑。

definition: to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
(coll.) to burst out laughing
to do sth wacky/wacky/wacky behavior
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
in deadly earnest/deadpan
to choke (on)/to choke off (in speech)
(loanword) humor/humorous
amusing/funny/entertaining
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
